You will be receiving them any time from now till 15 Dec, do keep a look out for your Card in the mailbox. :)

Meanwhile, please note that you can still use any of your existing Cards registered under your account to accumulate Stars and enjoy your Gold member benefits and rewards. The new program recognises your accounts instead of your Cards.

I have purchased 2 cards from ps outlet this morning and was advised to collect the gold keychain at later time when it is avaliable. Subsequently, I received a call from the personnel from ps outlet that the gold keychain did not come and they are left with the silver ones. I managed to find another outlet which has the gold ones and I asked whether can I collect the gold ones from them. This outlet advised me to contact ps outlet. I called the ps outlet n relayed the info to them that I have managed to find the gold ones at this outlet and whether can I collect the gold keychain from this outlet instead since I have yet to collect any from ps outlet n besides that ps outlet has no gold ones. Anyway, I have the receipt. The staff at ps outlet told me that they will contact this outlet on this matter. Till now, I have not received any update from ps outlet. Subsequently, the staff from this outlet called me to say that ps outlet has not contacted them n informed me that they will checked their side. Later, the staff at this outlet called me to say that they are unable to allow me to collect from them as the keychain is tagged to the card. This is a rather inflexible practice for starbucks to impose . I have not even collected the keychains and why can't I collect it from another outlet since the stocks are avaliable there. Besides that, if the staff at ps cannot guarantee the gold ones that I would not have bought 2 cards at once and instead source at other outlets. Lastly, no one at ps outlet offered me any solution. It is like just take the silver ones and get away. They did not even contact the outlet which has the gold keychain. In the end, the staff at the other outlet with the gold keychain even called me and updated me that they can't do anything at their side n provided me with a number to call. I am truly appalled by the system at starbucks for this episode. I felt so shortchanged and taken for a wild goose ride  and waiting game. I hope that starbucks singapore can give me an explanation on this matter. This issue has left a distaste in me and made me doubt the service quality and standard of Starbucks Singapore.

6.post_text:
Hi all,

We've been seeing many enquiring about our various "official Instagram" profiles that has promised to give away merchandise and other Starbucks items if you shared your personal details or screenshots of its page.

Starbucks Singapore does not have an Instagram account nor are we affiliated with these profiles mentioned. We would discourage you from sharing your data publicly as well. Please follow @starbucks on Instagram to follow our global profile and join in the conversation with other fans worldwide.

7.post_text:
Start earning Stars when we officially launch #MyStarbucksRewards in 2 days. Remember to update your app for iPhone on Thursday to access your Card via the app.

For more information on the new program: http://www.starbucks.com.sg/msr.html

comments.message:
Hi Joanne and Meng Han,

Yes an Android app is currently being built. We will announce it when it is ready. Thanks!

Hi Ah Yao EE and Nurada,

This Card acts as a normal Starbucks Card. However, it will only be assigned to our Gold level members. Our Gold members can use any of their Cards, including their Gold Card, to enjoy rewards with us. 

For more information: http://www.starbucks.com.sg/card/my-starbucks-rewards/what-is-my-starbucks-rewards

For more info on the new cards - http://www.starbucks.com.sg/card/my-starbucks-rewards/what-is-my-starbucks-rewards Basically,it's more like you spend-more-u-get--SAME-rewards,eg you need to be a Gold member (hit $300 spending) to be in the earn program (60 pts for a complimentary drink) vs current,any member get to earn (1 beverage = 1 count).Also,now u need to hit 60 points for a free drink (every $5 = 5 pts) vs current every beverage = 1 count (12 counts = free drinks)..so a hot tea that cost $4+ used to count as 1 beverage but under the new program it may not even earn any points.....a worse off program than the current one.
I feel that this announcement should be made earlier for people with 7-9 drinks to accumulate the last free drink. With less than two days to go, how are we supposed to buy 5 drinks in a day?!?!

I love the new system! As a loyal starbucks fan, its making every dollar I spent worth a pt. I hate the old system coz I'm always getting a grande or venti size and the count by cup is so not worth the value. Now I get rewarded by spending lesser. Thumbs up starbucks.

For those who are complaining, at least starbucks is making their loyal fan felt more special than anyone who visits starbucks like once or twice a yr.

I always drink double espresso... Which is less than $5...So I can forget earning rewards... N I dun need to stick to Starbucks to drink anymore... N I buy Starbucks coffee beans every 2 weeks... Costing $13... N I only got 10 points...
This system is not for me... N it's kinda stupid ...it's just drinking coffee... The old system is good enough... Simple n straightforward ...

really surprised and disappointed that a large organisation like starbucks would launch a new program without making sure that all systems are running smoothly on the 1st day. Many members would want to access the new members portal to check/confirm on their tier level etc and yet the system is not even ready at launch. If the portal has not been fully tested then starbucks should consider delaying the launch..
Why has my card disappeared from my iPhone app? The new rewards program is not even started! Just tried to get a drink and found it gone!
The NEW scheme sounds like Army guys taking IPPT yearly. 😂 $300 spending yearly in order to retain your GOLD statues. (Double 😂😂)

I wouldn't want the new program to take away the 7 coffee recorded as it's just a few more cups away...

14.post_text: @rosejmj 'sbeautifully crafted design takes home the gold.

comments.message: Fiona Toh
Can't see the options on the right.
Gorgeous!
Like batik

Starbucks is a coffee shop for a quick coffee & chat with friends or just to relax. How much serious study can one do in a busy shopping centre or complex? Go home or the library or any other quiet location so you can study. Quite often we have to find somewhere else to buy our coffee & unwind due to students buying 1 drink and squatting for hours. Starbucks are losing money with this practice. Be considerate, buy your drink and move on. Others are waiting to sit, drink & go. 
Maybe there could be a no study policy introduced to Starbucks. Your turn over will increase !

All I'm seeing now, is mob mentality. People shaming people. The girl has erred, but that will pass. Who then will be the next scapegoat for seat hogging? 

We may ostracise and discriminate, but that only serves to deepen the rot. 

Kudos to Starbucks Singapore for encouraging conversation with their clients. Open discourse and education is the way forward, not blatant appropriation of blame.
Esp evenings & wkends..fully booked by students studying with their laptops & tablets! It's so annoying!
Unfortunately anyone who claims "customers are always right" are usually the unreasonable ones!

Last time when i was a student, i failed all my exams when i studied in starbucks. Now i studied at home and pass all my exam with flying colour. So home is the best n ideas place for student to study for exam.

Studying when all is quiet is ok but if the place is crowded, leave. Give and take. Learn that the world does not revolve around you Huixin Yap. And LEAVING your stuff for half an hour and coming back expecting a warm welcome is very self entitled and extremely telling of a bad upbringing. The fact that you wrote (without remorse) that you left for half an hour shows you have No self awareness at all. Please remember, only your parents can "tahan" you. In the real world, no one gives a shit.
To all students: studying in a cafe/fastfood joint will not make u a scholar.

Frankly speaking, starbucks should just put up a notice to prevent students from studying in their outlet. It deprives of consumers who wish to enjoy a cup of coffee with their friends or family and lastly i do hope students will make it a habit to study somewhere else but not in any outlets hogging onto tables and chairs.

Back then we used to study at Starbucks too but we knew what was basic courtesy. During peak hours, we'd automatically make ourselves disappear and come back again after. Don't see why the current generation of youngsters can't think the same way... Truly a disappointment in what I'd term as a misunderstanding of "self-rights"
It is high time for you to reconsider of allowing studying in your outlets at any time of the day. It gets too annoying for me personally when I can't get any seat especially on weekends.

Oziair Bruce Lynch I went to Starbucks at Dauby Gaut (Not sure of Spelling) and could not get a table/seat at Starbucks. Eventually I sat at a chair and had to move the inconsiderate students computer and things so my Wife and I had enough room to sit at the bench. Their belongings were spread along the bench without any respect or consideration for others. Go home and study or go to the park or sow some respect. We do not sit there taking up spaces longer than we need to be. Starbucks would have to be loosing money catering to ignorant students and the occasional customer. Might I add that I have had an Art Exhibition in Singapore and have visited it more than 8 times, but my last trip really disappointed me with the ignorance of the younger Singaporeans with their talking or texting on their phones and expecting every other pedestrian to part like the red sea...I would not move out of their way unless they showed me some respect...otherwise I would just walk straight into them showing them the disrespect that they deserve!!! Love Singapore...but will never go there again!!!

Every time I go to a starbucks outlet, it's always full, and most of the people sitting are studying or something. I'm a loyal customer, I even received your email informing me that I've automatically been granted gold status. But, most of my orders are take away because I can't seem to find a vacant seat where I can just relax and drink my fave frapp. :(

We really cant please everyone. I enjoyed having a cup of dark mocca in Jurong point outlet with my children enjoying the cheesecakes. As much as i would like to stay longer , i feel bad for people looking for seats which 90 percent had been hogged by the students. So most of the time, we gave up the seat for them. I guess we should not wait for the service crew to "chase" away the students, we ourselves have to be automatic.
Customers are important however they are NOT always right!!

The manager should not be reprimanded; he should be given a raise. Firstly, he is protecting the rights of other paying customers who don't have to stand around while humanless belongings occupy a table for 30 minutes. Secondly, having read thru the self-entitled ranting of the student, I conclude the manager's lecture is a public service. People seldom speak up against bad behaviour nowadays, prefering to stay safe, which leads to more boldness in hooligan behaviour. The student acted disrespectfully but expected to be treated respectfully. Wake up!

can i bring a 27inch iMac and cable lock it to some fixture and use it at your outlet? :3 can bring dual monitors also cause no dual monitor i cannot work la...can bring speaker also? also can bring pillow? cause sit on hard chair for more than 2 hours my pigu will pain leh~
bags left at the joint for 30mins and bomb squad not activated? Singapore is going to pay dearly for being so complacent.
Ridiculous. Want to study please go student in a library / School / home. Don't freaking hog the seats.
Good on you and your manager, Starbucks! Some lessons are best taught and learnt outside of classrooms, after all. :)

Think you got to set tighter rules for space hogger students. It is just not right for them to occupy seat for hours to study. You should put up a notice and then not hesitate to ask them to leave if all they do is study. They can go home if they need to study.

SI KINNA GO HOME/SCHOOL STUDY LAH!
Dining places are for eating.
Cafes are for drinking.
Leave these places alone for us to eat and drink. Selfish si kinna I see your bags there but nobody around I call police say suspicious item.

It's hilarious that she left her coffee for 30 mins and demanded to have it replaced!! Lol. 
Try that in Rome Italy... They'll physically would beat you to a pulp for doing that.

personally feel that a drink should not equal to their 'customer rights' of hogging the tables for hours to study etc. There's a reason why libraries exist. It's disappointing every single time the outlets are always packed with people hogging the tables or seats to study etc. I believe there are tons of other customers out there that also deserve their fair share of right too! We too want a seat to chat and enjoy our drink.

With reference to the above incident, how dare they talk about customer rights when they were the ones themselves that left their belongings and went away for 30 mins. They are supposed to take care of their own belongings. Your staff was good enough to have kept their belongings for them. It could have been stolen, they should know this when they left their belonging UNATTENDED. Wow, demanding a free drink as compensation instead? RIDICULOUS.

If the students bought drinks and sat there to study, think it's ok. It's just like adults, buying coffee and reading a book. But to hog seats with bags while being away for as long as 30 min is ridiculous! 

However, if manager serves a half filled cup as a replacement, it's also ridiculous. Either replace or dun.

Let's all try to be nicer.
Thank you....often times, after a long day, I would just like a cup of your yummy frapp but can never find an empty table to sit and relax. Now, hopefully, I can!

15.post_text:
Thank you everyone for your contribution and thoughts on the recent table-hogging post from a customer. Your feedback is important to us to help us improve your Starbucks experience daily. With the passionate discussion, we do realize that it is something that connects deeply with you.

At Starbucks, we want our space to be a welcoming environment where everyone can enjoy their coffee with friends and family. It is your place as much as ours. We will continue to do our best to connect with any customer to seek their understanding on extended usage during the weekends and busy periods. 

Our actions are always made with you, our customers, in mind. We might make mistakes from time to time but we’re always here to listen to you today so that we can serve you better tomorrow. We take all your feedback online and in stores very seriously and we hope we can keep that healthy conversation going for years to come.

Regards,
The Starbucks Singapore Management Team

16.post_text:
Our cherished tradition combining lively Latin American beans with mellow Indonesian coffees and rare aged Sumatra returns. Rich and bold with alluring spice notes. Artfully roasted and expertly blended, the Starbucks® Christmas Blend complements the flavors of the season – and all your happy gatherings. 

The Starbucks® Christmas Blend Espresso Roast starts with many of the same coffees as in the much-loved Christmas Blend. But then we add the twist – a darker roast that adds a sweeter bite to the mellow smoothness you knew before. Deeper, darker and totally satisfying, this is an espresso roast for the ages.

Peppermint!!! Yay! Please don't take it away! And also, Peppermint white chocolate mocha frap is amazing.

correct me if i'm wrong,
its has been few months since I last buy a starbuck drink. saw this new promotion ytd, wanted to gives it a try... but... for something that priced more than a mac meal. I just ordered a normal size cranberry white chocolate mocha and with extra whipping cream.
Certainly the advertisement had me temping... but reality has me doubting to try again.
I smell Christmas!!!

22.post_text: Mocha thirty! It's time for some coffee. #livelovelatte #starbucksvia

comments.message:
Wanted to wind down with a really nice cup of Chai Tea Latte to end the evening. In the end, what I got was a wrong order despite repeating 5 times. Seriously doubt the integrity of the staff serving and ended up with a black face shown to me.

Seriously, no amount of promotional work will be enough if the service is as such.

23.post_text:
Add a shot of espresso, include some sweet syrup or even switch your milk to soy. 

On the this last day of treats, personalize your handcrafted drink with 1 free customization when you mention "Facebook Treats" at the counter. #makeityourown

comments.message: Hi. Please bring back the 1 for 1 treat.  Thanks

Pls brief ur staff properly. I asked for extra shot and ur staff said the promo was last Friday! Even after i showed the FB post
Hazelnut cappuccino done by the awesome baristas from bishan outlet! Thanks!
Gwen Tan Lee Molly

Too bad not all our local baristas are good at handling the 'secret menu'. 

Singapore Starbucks official menu is so limited when compared to USA's and UK's. Unfortunately, most of the secret menu recipes require a Vanilla Bean Creme Frap base (unavailable locally). So some of these 'baristas' actually went ahead to use an alternative which changes the whole taste totally. 

Kena a couple of times already! So Starbucks Singapore, either you expand your menu or you train your staffs better.
Hoshi Yoo

Starbucks Reserve and City Collections not included. Limited to 4 items per customer, while stocks last.
